headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: LZ Granderson is Interviewed about Civility in America; Bryant Gumbel is Interviewed about Journalism. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: BILL WEIR, CNN CHIEF CLIMATE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Infrastructure for sea level. And now inland infrastructure for droughts like this. You know, got to talk about this more guys. It's here.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: You have been - well, look, you've been ringing the alarm bells on this for years and years and years and years and showing us and warning us and now it accelerates.Bill Weir, we appreciate you being there always. Thank you, friend.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Bill.

utterances.speaker: WEIR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: All right, Michigan State has suspended four players who were involved in that post football game brawl. But, Michigan's coach, Jim Harbaugh, says he wants criminal and expects there to be criminal charges.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And Pfizer announcing a major development after promising results for an  RSV vaccine. We're back in a moment.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Great news for parents (ph).(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes, a big concern for parents.Meanwhile, Michigan head coach Jim Harbaugh says he expects the four Michigan State players who were suspended after they appeared to assault his players to potentially face criminal charges. New video appears to show one of the players from Michigan State swinging his helmet in the tunnel. You can see the violence that broke out after their game. Coach Harbaugh says the suspensions are not enough. Not even close, in his view. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JIM HARBAUGH, HEAD FOOTBALL COACH, UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
utterances.sentences: There needs to be accountability. There needs to be a full, thorough, timely investigation.I can't imagine that this will not result in criminal charges. The videos are - are - are bad. And it's clear what - what transpired. It seems very - very open and shut. You know, as they say, watch the tape. An apology will not get the job done in this instance. There should be serious consequences for the - the many individuals that are culpable. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Obviously two of the Michigan players were injured in that violence that broke out. The attorney for Gemon Green, who is one of the players who suffered a concussion, told, quote - told us, quote, they have every intention of pressing criminal charges against those persons who are responsible for this vicious assault.I mean it's just - obviously I'm a huge college football fan, but it's just unacceptable to see what happened.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. Unnecessary, uncalled for and there's no excuse for it.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: The political discourse in America, speaking of no excuse for this, sinking to new lows. Are calls for civility futile? We're going to take a closer look. That's next.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We also - we're going to have some fun this morning. Why not on day one? We have a little surprise coming up that you will not want to miss. Stick around. Who is it?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE). Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Who is it?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That was like a champ, the former president, Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Did you see Whitmer's face during that? She's just sitting there watching it all.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's how you handle it. I mean that was on the campaign trail in Michigan calling for basic civility. But is that call too late for America? We need to go back to that. I mean people talk about, you know, when - when John McCain did his thing or what have you. That's how you handle hecklers and disinformation. We don't do that anymore.Joining us now, LZ Granderson is a columnist for "The L.A. Times." His the latest column asks if we are part -- if we're past, I should say, the point of civility. Also, my friend, and our friend, friend of the show here.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Friend of the show.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I was joking. I was like, LZ, we - we never get to talk to each other.LZ GRANDERSON, CO-HOST, "MORNINGS WITH KEYSHAWN, LZ AND TRAVIS": We talk every day.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Like, I - like at least 15, 20 times a day.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Congratulations. This looks amazing, you guys. Happy first day.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Looks good.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you for coming.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And, guess what, this is not even our permanent set. Wait until you see our new home.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Setting the bar high.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: I hope I can come back.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You will.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: LZ, let's talk about this. You - you have a new column that is going to drop this morning for "The L.A. Times," but everybody goes back to that, you know, when they go low, we go high. Is that -- from the former first lady, Michelle Obama. Is that realistic in this moment?

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: You know, that's what I was trying to explore in this piece, right? Like, I want to still believe in that higher calling, right? But as we're still reaching for the higher calling, the people who are reaching for the lower callings are getting things done, right?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Like the Supreme Court situation. (INAUDIBLE) --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And they're the loudest voices.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: And they're the loudest voices, right? And there comes a point, and I have, you know, spoken to a lot of voters, I've spoken to a lot of grassroots leaders over the years and they're beginning to get more and more frustrated with playing nice with Republicans or conservatives

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Did you - did you see my -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I was just think that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: My conversation with Elissa Slotkin earlier? Because I said, listen, I - you know, I'm - I'm not sure what - I understand what she's saying. But I wanted to be clear about what people may be hearing about what she's saying. She's saying, you know, this win at all costs, obviously she's saying it is a bad - it's bad for democracy. And she's right on that - that point.But when you say, you know, winning is not the most important thing, Democrats may -- could be turned off by that and they may think, like, Democrats aren't strong enough because the whole point is to win and get your legislation passed to make it better for your particular constituents. Am I wrong about that?

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: No, no, you're not wrong. And we're in this weird transition as a nation, we're in this weird transition politically. I think we're still trying to figure out what Covid did to us culturally, if you will. I know I'm interacting differently interpersonally. I'm assuming a lot of us are. I mean when I hear a cough in a public space, it triggers me, right? You look, like -

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I'm the same. GRANDERSON

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: It has. And is - and it's really unfortunate. I think, you know, in 100 years or so, knock on plexiglass, if we're still here, that there will be like some Ph.D. student that will go back and look at what went wrong during this time period.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: And I think one of the biggest things that went wrong was allowing the lie to breathe in spaces where truth is supposed to reside. If you --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Allowing the lie - you mean the birtherism lie?

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: The birtherism lie.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And also allowing the person who perpetuated that lie to give them a platform.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: And allowed the person - exactly. Right. If that person had said, you know, the earth is flat and I have documentation, I'm going to show you soon that the earth is flat, we probably would not entertain that, right?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE). Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: But we did, for that purpose, because it was considered harmless and now it has (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, look at what -- we just had Elissa - Congressman Elissa Slotkin on, and she's going to be on the campaign trail tonight with Republican Congresswoman Liz Cheney, right, working together, even though they have many disagreements on issues.My four-year-old, Luca, working in his classroom, the teacher emailed us, on partner days. They pair them with people that they have different views on things with and they have to work together. Four years old, right? So, my kids don't know yet what it's like to go into a world where if you disagree it becomes like that for so many. And somehow that wins you points and votes in some circles, right? How do we get what we're teaching the four-year-olds to teach the people in charge?

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: You know what's interesting about -- we started this conversation about the former first lady's, when they go low, we go high. The larger part of that conversation, she was actually talking to her children about that.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: That's where that phrase comes from. So --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: After an attack on the White House.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: So the - so, what you're talking about, Poppy, is exactly that. Like, this is how you do it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: You raise adults who don't need to be reminded of this by having your children go through these type of programs.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. I just sometimes think, sometimes watching our kids helps remind us how to live. What they're learning.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, and the context of that again was when someone took shots at the residents in the White House -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And she was teaching her kids that just because they go low, you don't have to go low.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you, LZ.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you, LZ.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: You'll be back with us on Thursday, right?

utterances.speaker: GRANDERSON
utterances.sentences: Always good to see you. Yes, I am.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: See you Thursday.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: OK. Good.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Coming up --

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Coming up, we have a mystery guest that Poppy and I know who it is -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: But, guess what, Don Lemon does not. So we're going to reveal it next and we'll make him guess who it is first.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Guesses? Guesses? Guesses?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I hate surprises. I hate surprises.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Sorry. Sorry, you're going to like this one.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You're going to like this one.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I told you who I think it is.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: All right, to help --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh, I have a feeling this has to do with me.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Had a lot of coffee.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Talked about our family. Had a lot of coffee. And we talked about what and who inspire us.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Ah, interesting.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What was the moment you fell in love with journalism?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I turned on the television one day and I saw Bryant Gumbel. And I was like, that is what I want to do.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And I would pretend in the mirror and on my little 8mm or later VHS that I was like, you know, anchoring a show like the "Today" show. And I would say -- UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. And I would say, this is "Today" on NBC. But - but, whatever.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: OK, but now you're about to be anchoring a morning show. How cool is that?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.  Yes. And so - and that's when I fell in love with - like, I realized like just from watching those VHS tapes and that -- that I could do it.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I - it's just that. It's Bryant Gumbel.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: All right. So, this is a surprise for Don. We have a special guest. The legendary, the one --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I knew it. I got it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) Bryant Gumbel's live on set.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.BRYANT GUMBEL, HOST, HBO "REAL SPORTS WITH BRYANT GUMBEL": A really tough guess.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Bryant, I love you, man.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: How you doing, man?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I - look, don't make me cry on my first day.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Oh, you're not going to cry. You're not going to cry.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's like he thought it was going to be -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK. You get my chair, my friend. You get my chair. Come sit next to Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Wait, you didn't bring the person I love the most. Where is - where is your beautiful wife?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Where's Hillary (ph)?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: She's back at the house relaxing.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Hi, (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Good morning. How are you? Thanks so much for joining us.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: My pleasure.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's an honor to have you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, Bryant Gumbel.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: This is all you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: What's up?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Don thought it was going to be his family.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Why don't you tell me?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You remember what you -- I had dinner with you, what was it, two weeks ago?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think so.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Bryant is celebrating his 50th anniversary in the business two weeks ago and we sat down for dinner with Bryant and a bunch of friends, and you gave me advice. You said, two minutes in the show. What did you say?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Everybody always - everybody will always ask you what time you get up. They want to make a big deal about the sleep. I said there's two things that are common to everybody. Number one is, whatever time you get up you bitch about it. And, number two, the second you're in the shower it doesn't matter, right?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Clearly.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I actually think that -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Only Bryant Gumbel can say you bitch about it on - I just said it now.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And now Don Lemon can say it.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Oh, we're not -

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And you thought I was going to be the first one to curse on TV.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: That's not one of the seven deadly words you can't say.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's not one. Plus -

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: But it's not something you should say. You're right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You were on broadcast. This is cable, Bryant, you know, as you know.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That's right (ph).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And you should know that. You're the host of "Real Sports" on HBO.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: But I don't use bad language on it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You don't - you don't do that.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I try not to.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I was raised better than that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It was a really special moment, though, when we were talking about what this show would look like and what it meant to all of us. And Don really did talk about how he watched you and envisioned himself in a similar role.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Bet he wishes he was watching something else at the time. You weren't watching cartoons and said, no, I'd like to do that?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, I should have been watching, I don't know, the -- a movie or something and become a movie star. But you did. Bryant, you did inspire me. And you were perfect on television. You never flubbed a word. You're - I mean, you were great and you -

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I have a different memory of it, but thank you. I mean I never walked away from one saying I couldn't have done it better.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Really - yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: You know, I find a zillion things that are wrong with everything I try.But I was given a good opportunity and I was fortunate. I really was.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What did you learn over the years? Right, like this is day one. We have so many days ahead together. I think we're pretty darn lucky to be - like you, the group, you guys were great together and you were lucky to be with one another and you all were different and added so much. We're lucky to be together. What did you learn over the years?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: First of all, I will tell you this, I learned incremental.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: OK. You don't learn everything in a hurry. You try to learn something each day and pick up on that. But I guess patience is one of them. And understanding, tolerance,civility, like Barack Obama just said. You know, I mean I think just trying to be yourself on a day in, day out basis. As you know, it's a very difficult thing to do when everybody's watching.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Don's OK with it that I come in with my color-coded folders with sticky tabs.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Do you have them with you?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They're all - I've gone through all of them. We'll see them tomorrow morning.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I was worse. I was worse.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Were you? Listen to this.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I was worse. In my early days of the "Today" program, I color- coded guest materials based upon what their background was. In other words, if it was politics it was blue. If it was economy, it was green. If it was Hollywood, it was red. Et cetera. Honest to God.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm not surprised.Well, speaking of -- since we're in this moment, how has it changed?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: And, you know, we talk about civility and all of that. And, look, politics has always been a rough and tumble sport, but has it changed?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, I really think it has, and not for the better.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Not for the better.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Not for the better. I mean I do remember as I was watching you with Governor Sununu, I remember when Rob Brown died in a plane crash in Croatia, and at the time Republicans said nothing about it. And I went on the air and I asked somebody if that was politics as usual or just plain bad manners. And I got a reprimand from NBC. And NBC apologized, but I didn't. And so - and so I was watching that this morning and I was thinking, wow, the more (INAUDIBLE) the more (INAUDIBLE) -

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, I said - so - and so I was watching this morning, I was thinking, well, the more things change, the more they remain the same.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. But it aside, we - you know, I don't like to both sides things. And, listen, I'm not neither a Democrat nor a Republican.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: It's a false equivalence.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's a false equivalence. What's happening now is just beyond the pale and more people should vehemently speak out about the madness.Look at - I mean Paul Pelosi could have died.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And so every Republican should -- any available microphone should be speaking out and saying it's terrible, but they're not doing it for the most part.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: No, they're not. They're not. It's unfortunate.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And so what do you think is the way to handle that? You know, when you do see - you see people like Governor Sununu saying he expresses sympathy with the family, he condemned the attack, but then you've got another candidate for - to be a Republican governor, Kari Lake, who's laughing about it and making jokes about it.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I saw making - making a joke about it. And heaven knows DeSantis hasn't said anything either, that I'm aware of anyway. I should - I shouldn't do that.I don't know. I don't know any way other than to call it out when you see it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: And you would ask that - you would ask the same of anybody in any position in society. When you - what is it, when you see something, say something.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, talk about seeing something. You've got - these are the two sports brains over here.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Oh, I know. They're going to hate each other this weekend.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know. They're going to Alabama, LSU -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We'll hate each other this weekend through the Alabama game.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: They'll hate each other this weekend.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And they ask me, they're like, Pop, you want to come and you can referee. I was like, I am refereeing my four and six year old at home this weekend. That is that.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: That's a task.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But, have fun. We'll bring the cameras. You'll see it on Monday, guys.But - but, in all seriousness, sport, I mean, "Real Sports," this is your wheelhouse. And we just saw - we just played for the viewers what happened at Michigan.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, the Michigan - the Michigan.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes. And, you know, it's funny that they still - it's not funny. It's sad that they still do that at - at that stadium at UM. They go through the same tunnel.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: They go through the same tunnel.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: And they just had an incident I think two weeks ago of going through that same tunnel and, you know, cooler heads did not prevail. Yes, I mean that's -- that's clear assault. And I would expect some charges.I saw - I think I read that five of the kids have been suspended from the team during an investigation - pending an investigation.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Just, those are the role models that so many people look up to.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But, you know what, this reminds me, one of the reasons that I did this when I talked to you and other people and they're like, it's -- not often do you get to do something different at the place you already work, right, and sort of -- and challenge yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Good point.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But you did that with "Real Sports." And you have - I think what you always knew, but what you get to explore is that sports -- I mean, look, that -- that's what really changes things in the culture. It has a big impact on (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: It has a huge impact.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So this whole idea about shut up and dribble, and that's never been the case, right? GUMBEL

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: You know.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I mean we use -- we use sports as a vehicle to get to other stories about race, about gender, about equality, about income, you know, and that's how we use sports. Whether it's 3-2, it really doesn't matter much to us.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, look - look - I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And you see with Kyrie Irving with what happened.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: He was saying he wasn't going to apologize for talking about that movie that pushed these anti-Semitic tropes. And then you saw people seated on the court last night wearing their t-shirts about standing up to anti-Semitism.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Oh, I didn't see it. I missed it. I was out Halloweening.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, but if - I mean, but look - if you look at what happened, you know, in baseball. If you look what happened in tennis with Arthur Ashe, you know, on the basketball courts, or whatever, about social justice and civil rights, a lot -- that came from sports.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes, a lot of it comes from sports but it backfires sometimes too. Like, keep an eye on Georgia on Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Just saying. It backfire sometimes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Keep an eye on Georgia on Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We'll be up all night, all day, all night covering all of that.But let's get back - let's get back to Don.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Can I tell you this is - this is an out of body experience -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Sitting here with you on this set. I mean it's - I grew up -- I know you hate that I hate it now because -

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I know, I'm old. I know, I get it, I'm old.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: People come up to me and say, Don Lemon, I grew up watching you. I'm like, hey, I'm not that old. But I grew up watching you, Bryant, wanting to be you. And here you are sitting on the set with me on CNN.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Thank you, though.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And I get to spend, as I said to you at your anniversary is that it is just an honor for me to even be in the room with you.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I'm proud of you. I'm proud of you. Happy for you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Happy for you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you. You got any advice for me?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes, be nice to these two ladies.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, that is not - that is not a challenge. He's a dream (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I'm curious, what did you think when you -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: What you heard about Don getting this show?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I sent him a text right away.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I was surprised, but I wasn't. I knew that, you know, while it hadn't run his course, he was interested in doing something else. I didn't foresee this. But I told him I was here to help if he needs something.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: But he doesn't need anything.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, are you getting to bed earlier now that you don't have to watch me?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: You know, I go to bed late. It doesn't really matter. And I don't sleep much.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You don't sleep.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I'm not a sleeper.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: He just does not sleep.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: When I used to do this thing in the morning, I slept an average of about three hours a night.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: No. What?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, he did. That's what he told me. That's what he said, it doesn't matter in the shower.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And what do you sleep now?

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Probably about six.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Six on a good night.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, my.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Six or seven. Something like that.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: No, it's just I - I've never been -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It looks that way.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I've never been a -- I've never been a great sleeper. It really doesn't - you know, I guess I'll have plenty of time to sleep when it's all over and done.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Bryant -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I love you, buddy.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: I love you too, pal.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you for coming in for our main guys.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: My pleasure. My pleasure. Good luck to all of you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We're so happy to be with him.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's an honor to have you.

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Thank you. LEMON

utterances.speaker: GUMBEL
utterances.sentences: Thanks, pal.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.And thanks for watching, everyone. We're going to be back tomorrow. CNN NEWSROOM starts right now. We did it! First day.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: We'll see if we'll be back tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We did it.
